intro: Richeriella malayana, commonly known as the Malay richeriella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
